meanings.definition: To gather or cluster together in a rounded mass.
meanings.sent1: The children were conglobating around the teacher for storytime.
meanings.sent2: The snowballs were conglobating as the kids played in the park.
meanings.sent3: The puppies were conglobating in a cute, cuddly pile.
meanings.sent4: The stars conglobated in the night sky, forming beautiful constellations.
meanings.sent5: The colorful candies conglobated in the jar, creating a tempting display.

meanings.definition: To form into a rounded mass.
meanings.sent1: The artist was conglobating clay into a perfect sphere.
meanings.sent2: The dough was conglobating into a smooth ball as it was kneaded.
meanings.sent3: The clouds were conglobating playfully in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The thoughts in his mind conglobated into a clear plan of action.
meanings.sent5: The flowers conglobated into a beautiful bouquet for the wedding.
